abstract.text: An object that manages and advertises peripheral services exposed by this app.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: objects to manage published services within the local peripheral’s Generic Attribute Profile (GATT) database and to advertise these services to central devices (represented by
objects). While a service is in the database, any connected central can see and connect to it. That said, if your app hasn’t specified the

background mode, the contents of its services become disabled when it’s in the background or in a suspended state. In this scenario, any remote central trying to access the service’s characteristic value or characteristic descriptors receives an error.
methods, the peripheral manager object must be in the powered-on state, as indicated by the
. This state indicates that the device (your iPhone or iPad, for instance) supports Bluetooth low energy and that its Bluetooth is on and available for use.
In watchOS, tvOS, and visionOS, you can’t advertise services using a
object because support for doing so is unavailable.

abstract.text: Communicate with Bluetooth low energy and BR/EDR (“Classic”) Devices.
A representation of common aspects of services offered by a peripheral.
Values that represent the read, write, and encryption permissions for a characteristic’s value.
A remote device connected to a local app, which is acting as a peripheral.
The abstract base class that manages central and peripheral objects.
A remote peripheral device.
A protocol that provides updates on the use of a peripheral’s services.
An object that manages and advertises peripheral services exposed by this app.
Publishes a service and any of its associated characteristics and characteristic descriptors to the local GATT database.
Returns the app’s authorization status for sharing data while in the background.
The delegate object specified to receive peripheral events.
Initializes the peripheral manager without a delegate.
Initializes the peripheral manager with a specified delegate and dispatch queue.
Initializes the peripheral manager with a specified delegate, dispatch queue, and initialization options.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the peripheral is advertising data.
Creates a listener for incoming L2CAP channel connections.
Removes a specified published service from the local GATT database.
Removes all published services from the local GATT database.
Responds to a read or write request from a connected central.
Sets the desired connection latency for an existing connection to a central device.
Advertises peripheral manager data.
Stops advertising peripheral manager data.
Removes a published service from the local system.
Send an updated characteristic value to one or more subscribed centrals, using a notification or indication.
Values representing the current authorization state of the peripheral manager.
Values representing the connection latency of the peripheral manager.
A protocol that provides updates for local peripheral state and interactions with remote central devices.
Values that represent the current state of the peripheral manager.
A manager state that indicates Bluetooth is currently powered on and is available to use.
Keys used to specify options when creating a peripheral manager.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
